channel.title: Slow shutdown of version 15 workstation and gateway
channel.description:
Opening up this issue from previous thread.
Since installing version 15 the shutdown for both is very slow (up to 2 minutes or more). It is like it is hanging waiting for certain jobs to complete but there is no indicator of what is happening since the screen is black but only the cursor flashing til they finally shutdown.

item.title: Slow shutdown of version 15 workstation and gateway
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Whonix 16 moved away from lightdm (because auto login was broken, heisenbug, non-responsive upstream) to gdm3. Let me know if this is still an issue on Whonix 16 after upgrades.

Read full topic
item.source: Slow shutdown of version 15 workstation and gateway

item.title: Slow shutdown of version 15 workstation and gateway
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
[Help Welcome] KVM Development - staying the course KVM
What’s a good virtual CPU count for KVM? Currently it’s 1. Maybe 2 would be better? Any disadvantages of that? Would that workaround bug Slow shutdown of version 15 workstation and gateway? Maybe if there are 4 physical CPUs, one should not assign 4 virtual CPUs to a KVM VM? Could have a similar issue as VirtualBox? https://www.virtualbox.org/ticket/19500 Which performance benefit are you referring to?

Read full topic
item.source: Slow shutdown of version 15 workstation and gateway

item.title: Slow shutdown of version 15 workstation and gateway
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
Pingaeir:

EDIT: Just switching to 2 gig didn’t seem to do it, but increasing cpu too seems to have worked, if not that then keep upping them til it does as the workstation works consistently and I have that at 4 cpu/4 gig I think.

If you are increasing cpu count while pinned then you won;t be really getting any increased perf benefit.

Read full topic
item.source: Slow shutdown of version 15 workstation and gateway

item.title: Slow shutdown of version 15 workstation and gateway
item.dc:creator: Pingaeir
item.description:
Hey guys, heads up, I have found the solution.

Just up your ram to 2gigs. It has solved the issue for me.

I wanted to increase specs on the workstation for other reasons and noticed this problem was not occuring any more and so upped it to 2gb on the gateway as well and it seems to have fixed it there too.

EDIT: Just switching to 2 gig didn’t seem to do it, but increasing cpu too seems to have worked, if not that then keep upping them til it does as the workstation works consistently and I have that at 4 cpu/4 gig I think.

Though it depends how much you wanna use just to solve that issue :). My local machine rarely is needed for much so I can afford to use it for the short instances I want to run whonix.

Read full topic
item.source: Slow shutdown of version 15 workstation and gateway

item.description:
Me too bro.

Read full topic

item.title: Slow shutdown of version 15 workstation and gateway
item.dc:creator: Pingaeir
item.description:
I am currently avoiding the problem by just forcing shutdown for WS/GW. It is ugly but I only use read-only version so dataloss is not an issue.

Read full topic

item.source: Slow shutdown of version 15 workstation and gateway

item.title: Slow shutdown of version 15 workstation and gateway
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
rk1:

First problem I have is you say it is a lightdm bug. How do you know it is?

Because the log contains:

Patrick:

Jan 24 11:13:38 host systemd[1]: session-1.scope: Killing process 1956 (lightdm) with signal SIGKILL.

This means systemd sends the usual sigterm signal which lightdm ignores and then when that didn’t work it sends the sigkill command. I.e. lightdm does not react to sigterm for some reason.

rk1:

Or you mean to say that lightdm as used in Whonix is the same lightdm used in Ubuntu?

No. Lightdm from Debian https://packages.debian.org/buster/lightdm

You could report to Debian too and the Debian maintainer should in theory forward the bug upstream. But my experience is this takes a long time. It is useful to report bugs to Debian. Often the maintainer or someone knows something. But contacting the upstream developer directly makes sense too.

rk1:

I want to report the bug like you suggested, but how to do so is not crystal clear.

Don’t assume it’s more clear to me.
Just contact upstream somehow. Then see how it goes. Preferably in public to have a reference and give others to share their thoughts well. I’d open a bug on launchpad even if’s not 100% correct that’s not a crime. If it is the wrong place, someone will point out a better place.

Read full topic
item.source: Slow shutdown of version 15 workstation and gateway

item.title: Slow shutdown of version 15 workstation and gateway
item.dc:creator: rk1
item.description:
@Patrick
I want to report the bug like you suggested, but how to do so is not crystal clear. First problem I have is you say it is a lightdm bug. How do you know it is? Second when I go to launchpad -> robert-ancell, I see lightdm is one of his packages. But everywhere it says lightdm in Ubuntu. And the problem of slow shutdown arises in Whonix. Or you mean to say that lightdm as used in Whonix is the same lightdm used in Ubuntu?

Read full topic
item.source: Slow shutdown of version 15 workstation and gateway

item.title: Slow shutdown of version 15 workstation and gateway
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
That log looks very similar to mine and I don’t see any errors there. Looks like proper termination.

I have no idea.

I suggest to report a bug against Debian.

And/or upstream original developers.

Patrick:

Quote https://wiki.debian.org/LightDM

lightdm is developed at Canonical by Robert Ancell

https://launchpad.net/~robert-ancell

They might ask for a backtrace.

(similar this post Slow shutdown of version 15 workstation and gateway)

Read full topic
item.source: Slow shutdown of version 15 workstation and gateway

Read full topic
item.source: Slow shutdown of version 15 workstation and gateway

item.title: Slow shutdown of version 15 workstation and gateway
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Please don’t share otd (libre office or so) files. Plain text much better. However the workstation log was plain text and it gave another lead.

Last OK message:

Jan 24 11:12:08 host systemd[1]: Stopped Encrypted Swap File Creator.

Then takes a long time. Then:

Jan 24 11:13:38 host systemd[1]: session-1.scope: Stopping timed out. Killing.
Jan 24 11:13:38 host systemd[1]: session-1.scope: Killing process 1956 (lightdm) with signal SIGKILL.
Jan 24 11:13:38 host systemd[1]: session-1.scope: Failed with result ‘timeout’.
Jan 24 11:13:38 host systemd[1]: Stopped Session 1 of user user.

Would require debugging lightdm.

Quote https://wiki.debian.org/LightDM

lightdm is developed at Canonical by Robert Ancell

https://launchpad.net/~robert-ancell

Added some instruction on how to get a lightdm debug log just now:

https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Troubleshooting#lightdm

Read full topic
item.source: Slow shutdown of version 15 workstation and gateway

@Patrick
The files were too big for paste.debian also. So you can download them here:

TransferBigFiles.com

Transfer Big Files

TransferBigFiles.com allows computer users to send large files to anyone. Videos, pictures, documents or any other file that is too large to send as an email attachment can be sent through TransferBigFiles.com


with password: 6WkznRLkYhs3bXQ

item.source: Slow shutdown of version 15 workstation and gateway

item.title: Slow shutdown of version 15 workstation and gateway
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Possibly.

rk1:

Stopping Session 1 of user user.

Taking a long time on the screenshot. And just before that, the segfault.

I might be able to say more when systemd journal logs are provided as per Slow shutdown of version 15 workstation and gateway

Read full topic
item.source: Slow shutdown of version 15 workstation and gateway

item.title: Slow shutdown of version 15 workstation and gateway
item.dc:creator: rk1
item.description:
@Patrick:
The segfault, right, should be reported, sure, when I get my Whonix system hardened I might do this (will let you know by that time). But the original aim of reporting the console messages was to tackle the slow shutdown. So was the “stop job” with the timer the culprit here?

Read full topic
item.source: Slow shutdown of version 15 workstation and gateway

item.title: Slow shutdown of version 15 workstation and gateway
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
rk1:

[ 91.529837] xfce4-panel[1231]: segfault at 8cf5a0c19 ip 00007d46c948cdb0 sp 00007ffeb342a4e0 error 4 in libc-2.28.so[7d46c942f000+148000]
[ 91.532063] Code: f0 48 01 f2 4c 8b 68 08 4d 89 ec 49 83 e4 f8 49 39 f4 0f 85 da 00 00 00 4e 3b 24 20 0f 85 c0 00 00 00 48 8b 70 10 4c 8b 60 18 <48> 39 46 18 0f 85 9e 00 00 00 49 39 44 24 10 0f 85 93 00 00 00 4c

This needs to be reported upstream against XFCE.

https://bugzilla.xfce.org/

They might ask for a backtrace.

https://docs.xfce.org/contribute/bugs/start#backtraces

Debian specific instructions:
https://wiki.debian.org/HowToGetABacktrace

For simplify, you’d need this package too:
debug-misc opt-in package to easily enable debugging

Let me know if anyone wants to proceed debugging this.

Read full topic
item.source: Slow shutdown of version 15 workstation and gateway

item.title: Slow shutdown of version 15 workstation and gateway
item.dc:creator: rk1
item.description:
Ok, I did as HulaHoop asked. I cannot upload txt files, so I will paste the flurry of messages right here. But before I do so let me make an observation. I noticed that midway the shutdown process (of both Gateway and Workstation) the process halts, mentioning that a stop job is underway and a timer is set for 1 m 29 sec. When that period of time has passed the shutdown continues…

So maybe we already pinpointed the problem. But here is the shutdown process for the Gateway:

#[14;0]user@host:~$ sudo shutdown
[sudo] password for user:

item.title: Slow shutdown of version 15 workstation and gateway
item.dc:creator: rk1
item.description:
Just want to confirm what Pingaeir says. On my system shutdown of Whonix gateway and workstation does take about 2 minutes, every time. Same version 15.0.0.7.1 and kvm.

Read full topic
item.source: Slow shutdown of version 15 workstation and gateway

item.title: Slow shutdown of version 15 workstation and gateway
item.dc:creator: Pingaeir
item.description:
I guess that it is some process that is not shutting itself off gracefully and there has to be that 1min30 timeout for the system to do it because that can happen when I shutdown archlinux (though only occasionally if I left something running which would not shutdown gracefully). So I guess that happens here but on nearly every shutdown for some reason but can’t see it due to journalctl not being on by default.

I will put it on and see what it says and get back to you when I find out more.

I will say that about 1 in 10 times it shuts down in the 3 seconds that you guys say but it is very rare and no idea how to get it to do it as it doesn’t seem related to what programs I ran or how long the vm was up.

Read full topic
item.source: Slow shutdown of version 15 workstation and gateway
